pull_request.title: [exif] Insure that Exif.Image.Orientation is written as a ushort to avoid compatibility issues
pull_request.body:
## Description

After going down a long, long rabbit hole, I came out of it with this new knowledge: when setting the Exif.Image.Orientation metadata using the Exiv2 library, it *must be* casted as a ushort to insure maximum compatibility with image readers out there. A number of application handling jpeg images will not recognize this tag otherwise. 

This includes - but is not limited to - Qt itself, which chokes if the value isn't in ushort.

issue.title: Overlay conditions with lines seems inconsistent ( GEOS version 3.10.3-CAPI-1.16.1)

labels.name: Feedback
labels.description: Waiting on the submitter for answers

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

labels.name: Digitizing
labels.description: Related to feature digitizing map tools or functionality

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

Maybe this is resolved already, but 3.26 should still have this issue (my 3.27 build is getting old).

When testing conditions I noticed some strangeness. 
![overlay_exp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12854129/189388947-9372e9ed-4986-4ac5-ad83-b592a3c21001.gif)

When changing the middle vertex of a line, where the edge vertex should be snapped on the line, displacing the middle vertex changes the results.

I don't know if the issue comes with the snapping or the tolerance threshold in GEOS or something else, but this seems problematic if we want reliable results.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

[test_overlay_conditions.zip](https://github.com/qgis/QGIS/files/9536871/test_overlay_conditions.zip)

Use the provided project to test overlay agl and results by moving vertices, do the same as in the gif.

### Versions

Tested on 3.27 on win 10.

### Supported QGIS version

- [X] I'm running a supported QGIS version according to the roadmap.

### New profile

- [ ] I tried with a new QGIS profile

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: Can't reproduce with the latest master (8c8a43b44e06af3c6577d287fecf672c7c1fe3dc)

issue.title: QGIS crash while opening directory from projects list

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

QGIS 3.26.2, after opening the app, go to the recent projects list in the main Canvas (before opening any project), if we right click a project and choose "Open directory", QGIS will crash. 


### Steps to reproduce the issue

Open QGIS, from the main canvas -> Recent projects, right click on any and choose "open directory". 

### Versions

3.26.2-Buenos Aires

### Supported QGIS version

- [X] I'm running a supported QGIS version according to the roadmap.

### New profile

- [X] I tried with a new QGIS profile

### Additional context

QGIS 3.26.2 running in MacOS Monterey 12.5.1.

issue.title: Advanced digitizing lock coordinate shortcut disabled by icon hover

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

labels.name: Digitizing
labels.description: Related to feature digitizing map tools or functionality

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

If you use the Advanced Digitizing toolbar you can normally use Ctrl-X and Ctrl-Y to lock coordinates before clicking to digitize. Howver if you happen to hover over the padlock icons corresponding to X and Y lock coordinate, showing the tool tip, the shortcut function becomes disabled. The workaround is to actually click on the padlock which seems to reenable the ability to use the shortcut

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Create a line layer that can use the Advanced Digitizing toolbar
Enable Advanced Digitizing 
Click and create a vertex
Move mouse cursor  and use Ctrl-X and Ctrl-Y and observe the constraint working
Move cursor and hover over the X or Y padlock in Advanced Digitizing toolbar
Move back over the map and pressing Ctrl-X or Ctrl-Y no loner activates the lock coordinate functions
Click on the lock coordinate padlock and create a new vertex
Create another vertex and you finc Ctrl-X and Ctrl-Y now work.

Recorded a session demonstrating this here :-
https://youtu.be/E_2PJs0Gkgc


### Versions


QGIS version
3.24.2-Tisler
QGIS code revision
13c1a028
Qt version
5.15.2
Python version
3.9.5
GDAL/OGR version
3.4.2
PROJ version
9.0.0
EPSG Registry database version
v10.054 (2022-02-13)
GEOS version
3.10.2-CAPI-1.16.0
SQLite version
3.38.1
PDAL version
2.3.0
PostgreSQL client version
unknown
SpatiaLite version
5.0.1
QWT version
6.1.3
QScintilla2 version
2.11.5
OS version
Windows 10 Version 2009

### Supported QGIS version

### New profile

issue.title: Unable to move mesh elements

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

labels.name: Digitizing
labels.description: Related to feature digitizing map tools or functionality

labels.name: Mesh
labels.description: Related to general mesh layer handling (not specific data formats)

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

I'm hardly trying to move mesh elements and I fail every time. The elements are supposed to become green so that I could release them at their new location, but they stay red.
Considering that https://github.com/qgis/QGIS/pull/44037#issue-936039124 shows mesh elements being moved, this is a regression.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

[Capture vidéo du 01-09-2022 23:26:17.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7983394/188020782-179e1196-fedf-4fa4-a316-47d100a7f37e.webm)

issue.title: QgsMapCanvas.mapToolSet() signal wrong parameter types

labels.name: PyQGIS
labels.description: Related to the PyQGIS API

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

The signal QgsMapCanvas.mapToolSet() parameters newTool and oldTool should always have type QgsMapTool. This work for most of the Map Tools, but has some problems with the Selection Map Tools (Select Feature(s) and Select Features by Polygon/Freehand/Radius) which are passed with type QObject. 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Connect the signal to a function
2. In the function print the type name of both parameters
3. Check in the QGIS GUI the different types by selecting the different map tools

### Versions

3.22.10

### Supported QGIS version

- [X] I'm running a supported QGIS version according to the roadmap.

### New profile

- [ ] I tried with a new QGIS profile

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: "Digitize mesh elements" (rubberband) is not persistent across tools selection

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

labels.name: Digitizing
labels.description: Related to feature digitizing map tools or functionality

labels.name: Mesh
labels.description: Related to general mesh layer handling (not specific data formats)

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

1. Select the "Digitize mesh elements" and start drawing a face. You get the rubber band.
1. Select another layer or another tool (feature identifier, select mesh elements,...). The rubber band is still there.
1. Reactivate the "Digitize mesh elements" tool. I would expect the rubber band to be reactivated also and follow the cursor so that I'd continue digitizing my feature. But instead you have to abort the previous drawing and start a new one. Not consistent with vector behavior.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7983394/187785562-31033b6a-0ce2-448c-aff1-d1443487f173.mp4

In this video, I'm unable to get the rubber band follow the cursor, and I can't really tell how I ended up with the final face; it looks like the rubber band was actually following the cursor but just not updated in the canvas!?



### Versions

issue.title: [Mesh] Pressing Backspace removes new edges of a face being drawn but not the new vertices

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

labels.name: Digitizing
labels.description: Related to feature digitizing map tools or functionality

labels.name: Mesh
labels.description: Related to general mesh layer handling (not specific data formats)

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

When drawing a mesh layer face, pressing backspace key undoes the actions. If you are digitizing the faces by adding their own vertices (that is, not snapping to already existing ones), I'd expect the backspace button to also remove the vertex the process is adding, not only the edges. Otherwise, you end up with free vertices over the map canvas (you'd have to delete in a further step).
IOW, vertex addition should also be in the history of actions when you are creating a face.
[Capture vidéo du 31-08-2022 22:00:27.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7983394/187771343-ff3f8a74-20eb-4dae-8a5a-1b9796abfa8f.webm)


### Steps to reproduce the issue

In the video, when I press Backspace key, the edges that were being drawn are rolled back. But not the vertices I added in parallel. To remove the vertices, I had to press the Undo button

[Capture vidéo du 31-08-2022 22:00:27.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7983394/187771343-ff3f8a74-20eb-4dae-8a5a-1b9796abfa8f.webm)

### Versions

issue.title: [Mesh] Pressing Backspace removes new edges of a face being drawn but not the new vertices

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

labels.name: Digitizing
labels.description: Related to feature digitizing map tools or functionality

labels.name: Mesh
labels.description: Related to general mesh layer handling (not specific data formats)

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

When drawing a mesh layer face, pressing backspace key undoes the actions. If you are digitizing the faces by adding their own vertices (that is, not snapping to already existing ones), I'd expect the backspace button to also remove the vertex the process is adding, not only the edges. Otherwise, you end up with free vertices over the map canvas (you'd have to delete in a further step).
IOW, vertex addition should also be in the history of actions when you are creating a face.
[Capture vidéo du 31-08-2022 22:00:27.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7983394/187771343-ff3f8a74-20eb-4dae-8a5a-1b9796abfa8f.webm)

In the video, when I press Backspace key, the edges that were being drawn are rolled back. But not the vertices I added in parallel. To remove the vertices, I had to press the Undo button

issue.title: QGIS 3.22.10  cursor at the wrong place while writing a filter

labels.name: GUI/UX
labels.description: Related to QGIS application GUI or User Experience

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

When I write a filter for a QGIS-Layer, the cursor is not at the right place (directly after the sign I just wrote) - the cursor seems to be further to the right. So it is difficult to write filters more complicated. The mistake does not occur when I use QGIS in American English, but it occurs for example in German or in Spanish. The mistake does not occur in QGIS 3.26, it occurs only in QGIS 3.22.10 (as far as I know the mistake did not occur in QGIS 3.22.9)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Open a new filter for an existing layer
2. write for example "name"='Switzerland'

you will see, that the cursor is not at the end of ='Switzerland' - but further right. So if you want to modificate the filter, or delete some letters, it is difficult to handle.
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56157092/187697535-01b41b1b-4d73-4218-acc1-95aad74c9d6b.png)


### Versions

QGIS 3.22.10

### Supported QGIS version

- [X] I'm running a supported QGIS version according to the roadmap.

### New profile

- [X] I tried with a new QGIS profile

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: Still an issue with latest versions?

issue.title: Text in PDF exported from QGIS cannot be edited in Illustrator

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

labels.name: Print Layouts
labels.description: Related to QGIS Print Layouts, Atlas or Reporting frameworks

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

The latest update of QGIS is amazing. A big problem persists: I cannot edit text in an exported PDF in Illustrator.

When I export to PDF, I have the option to export text as text objects turned on. I can edit the text in Acrobat, but it’s not as good as Illustrator for making adjustments. The problem is that every typeface I use in QGIS brings up the Missing Fonts dialog in Illustrator, even for the most common, such as Arial.

Furthermore, every letter becomes individual; there are no longer words.

This doesn’t happen from any other program I use regularly (Word and InDesign), even if I use less-common fonts that I might expect to cause a problem.

Has anyone experienced this? Does anyone have an insight into how I might fix the problem?

### Steps to reproduce the issue

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13306286/187030569-232f0c9f-1db7-44b1-a051-97e48034386e.png)

issue.title: Project Export DXF: Output Layer Attribute not visible

labels.name: GUI/UX
labels.description: Related to QGIS application GUI or User Experience

labels.name: DXF/DWG
labels.description: Relating to DXF or DWG importing/exporting

labels.name: Regression
labels.description: Something which used to work, but doesn't anymore

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

The column 'Layer' and the column 'Output Layer Attribute' in the Project DXF Export cannot be resized. Consequently the option 'Output Layer Attribute' is not visible without scrolling at the bottom. 

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102646618/186608638-1ddd329c-a0b8-40d5-930a-7236a1482cba.png)
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102646618/186608809-0ece4ef4-5a90-4dee-9c97-b943c9159b45.png)


### Steps to reproduce the issue

Project -> Import/Export -> Export Project to DXF...

### Versions

QGIS version | 3.26.2-Buenos Aires | QGIS code revision | feec3d3b12f
-- | -- | -- | --
Qt version | 5.15.3
Python version | 3.9.5
GDAL/OGR version | 3.5.1
PROJ version | 9.0.1
EPSG Registry database version | v10.064 (2022-05-19)
GEOS version | 3.10.3-CAPI-1.16.1
SQLite version | 3.38.1
PDAL version | 2.4.2
PostgreSQL client version | unknown
SpatiaLite version | 5.0.1
QWT version | 6.1.6
QScintilla2 version | 2.13.1
OS version | Windows 10 Version 2009


### Supported QGIS version

- [X] I'm running a supported QGIS version according to the roadmap.

### New profile

- [X] I tried with a new QGIS profile

### Additional context

I suspect, many don't even know of this possibility (see [issue 48724)](https://github.com/qgis/QGIS/issues/48724)

issue.title: Gaps in features (lines) generated with Write vector tiles

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

In generated _vector tiles_ exists unexpected gaps especially at intersections. Exaple output tiles with this error: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22734057/186422934-087ec5ec-91ea-43c2-b5a1-65ba85cd0549.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22734057/186423086-8b0c92ce-11ee-4e8d-91e5-c53dc57b6268.png)




### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Go to Processing > Write vector tiles (XYZ or MBTiles)
2. Select one MultiLineString layer
3. Set zoom level e.g. 0-15
4. Run process
5. See generated optput (e.g. open .mbtile file in QGIS)

issue.title: Processing tools assign CRS EPSG:4326 despite there is no CRS available

labels.name: Processing
labels.description: Relating to QGIS Processing framework or individual Processing algorithms

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

Processing tools assign CRS EPSG:4326 despite there is no CRS available:

- if input data is loaded via `Select file ...`
- the global setting about how to handle layer with no CRS is not applied

Screencast:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20856381/186135025-c9917898-4ef4-439e-8ea3-6fd5fb55b23f.mp4




### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Use the following settings for _Settings_ -> _Options_ -> _CRS and Transforms_ -> _CRS handling_
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20856381/186134157-10f74bdd-14c2-4f40-a61c-71a0f9313ff7.png)
2. Use `Drop field(s)`-processing-tool
3. Choose [test.zip](https://github.com/qgis/QGIS/files/9401672/test.zip) via `Select file ...` :
4. Select a field to drop
5. Run tool
6. Check CRS of created layer -> see error: CRS is EPSG:4326



### Versions

QGIS version | 3.27.0-Master | QGIS code revision | 77aa81ce9d
-- | -- | -- | --
Qt version | 5.15.2
Python version | 3.9.2
GDAL/OGR version | 3.2.2
PROJ version | 7.2.1
EPSG Registry database version | v10.008 (2020-12-16)
GEOS version | 3.9.0-CAPI-1.16.2
SQLite version | 3.34.1
PostgreSQL client version | 13.7 (Debian 13.7-0+deb11u1)
SpatiaLite version | 5.0.1
QWT version | 6.1.4
QScintilla2 version | 2.11.6
OS version | Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

### Supported QGIS version

- [X] I'm running a supported QGIS version according to the roadmap.

### New profile

- [X] I tried with a new QGIS profile

### Additional context

The testdata used here is a Shapefile, but the issue happens also with other formats, e.g. GML.

comment.body:
Not reproducible with the latest master (8c8a43b44e06af3c6577d287fecf672c7c1fe3dc) in the same way as described. For me output has no CRS like input layer no matter if I use temporary output or save to file.

Not sure this is a bug, default CRS is only applied when layer is added to canvas.

issue.title: Layer tree view is not refreshing correctly

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Either a bug report, or a bug fix. Let's hope for the latter!

issue.body:
### What is the bug or the crash?

After creating a point symbols and set them expression, the layer tree view show wrong color.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Craete point symbol
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62249638/184867139-3fee5305-588b-4cb6-b06e-0aa34351f414.png)

2. Set expression to fill color and stroke color.
For me it was '1,255,18,255'
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62249638/184865458-2225a9c8-70e8-449f-a0d8-994e9c7010c8.png)
3. Layer tree view show incorrect colors.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62249638/184867266-a4d85df2-b05c-4617-aab1-596331b956ff.png)




### Versions

I was checking this bug on two QGIS versions 3.24 and 3.26
